excerpt: Founded in 1874, no zoo in Switzerland is home to more animals, from gorillas to snow leopards.
detail_description: Established in 1874, Zoo Basel is the oldest zoo in Switzerland and a must-visit attraction. Known as "Zolli" by locals, it houses a diverse range of animals including gorillas, snow leopards, lions, elephants, giraffes, and chimpanzees. The well-maintained park offers a pleasant summer stroll while the animal houses and vivarium are popular during winter.
name: Zoo Basel

excerpt: Permanent display of the works of Jean Tinguely, plus temporary exhibitions of other modern artists.
detail_description: Museum Tinguely in Basel, Switzerland, is a tribute to the renowned Swiss artist Jean Tinguely. The museum boasts the world's largest collection of Tinguely's art, featuring a permanent exhibition showcasing his work over four decades. Additionally, it hosts temporary exhibitions that not only highlight Tinguely's influence but also shed light on other modern artists who inspired him. This museum offers a unique and impressive experience for art enthusiasts visiting Basel.
name: Museum Tinguely

excerpt: Works by Holbein & other artists in the region from 1400–1600 & in the 19th & 21st centuries.
detail_description: Kunstmuseum Basel, also known as the Fine Art Museum, is a renowned art institution with an extensive collection spanning from the 15th to the 21st century. It features works by Holbein and other regional artists from different periods. The museum is part of Basel's rich cultural scene, which includes various privately funded museums and galleries. Visitors can explore diverse experiences such as the Pharmacy Museum, Cartoon Museum, and Paper Mill Museum.
name: Kunstmuseum Basel

excerpt: This regal, 15th-century gateway is one of 3 remaining from the city's ancient walls.
detail_description: Spalentor is a majestic 15th-century gateway that stands as one of the three remaining structures from the ancient walls of the city. It is located in Basel, a city known for its significance in the chemical and pharmaceutical industry, with major companies like Novartis and Hoffmann-La Roche being among Switzerland's largest employers.
name: Spalentor

excerpt: Museum with a vast collection of doll, teddy bear & miniature toy exhibits displayed over 4 floors.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Basel, Switzerland, the Toy Worlds Museum Basel is a captivating attraction dedicated to the world of toys. Originally known as the Dollhouse Museum Basel, this enchanting museum boasts a vast collection of dolls, teddy bears, and miniature toy exhibits displayed across four floors. Established in 1996, it offers visitors a nostalgic journey through various eras and cultures with its charming exhibits and interactive displays.
name: Toy Worlds Museum Basel

excerpt: Exhibits spread over 3 adjacent sites with paintings, cathedral treasures, furniture & archeology.
detail_description: The Basel Historical Museum - Barfuesserkirche is a part of the larger museum complex in Basel, Switzerland. It houses a diverse range of exhibits including paintings, cathedral treasures, furniture, and archaeology. The collection of antiquities has a rich history dating back to early Basel and is now housed in the Antikenmuseum at St. Alban-Graben 5/7.
name: Basel Historical Museum - Barfuesserkirche

excerpt: Basel is a city on the Rhine River in northwest Switzerland, close to the country’s borders with France and Germany. Its medieval old town centers around Marktplatz, dominated by the 16th-century, red-sandstone Town Hall. Its 12th-century Gothic cathedral has city views, and contains the tomb of the 16th-century Dutch scholar, Erasmus. The city’s university houses some of Erasmus’ works.
detail_description: Basel, located in northwest Switzerland near the borders of France and Germany, is a charming city with a medieval old town featuring the impressive Town Hall and Gothic cathedral. The city is renowned for its ancient masked carnival, Fasnacht, which dates back to the 14th century. This three-day affair is a lively celebration that reflects Basel's vibrant and friendly atmosphere. With invigorating nightlife and a youthful vibe, Basel offers an off-the-beaten-path party experience in Europe.
name: Basel

excerpt: Historic stone bridge linking old & new city areas & offering stellar river & architecture views.
detail_description: Mittlere Brücke, also known as Middle Bridge, is a historic stone bridge in Basel, Switzerland. It has been an iconic sight since its construction in 1226 and offers stunning views of the river and surrounding architecture. The bridge was initially built as a crucial link for traders traveling through the Gotthard Pass. Over time, it became a symbol of the city's rich history.
name: Mittlere Brücke

excerpt: Collections of decorative Ancient Greek, Egyptian, Roman & Etruscan art in an elegant townhouse.
detail_description: Antikenmuseum Basel und Sammlung Ludwig is a charming townhouse that hosts an impressive collection of decorative art from Ancient Greece, Egypt, Rome, and Etruria. The museum also delves into the captivating history of pharmacology with one of the world's largest collections of pharmaceutical artifacts.
name: Antikenmuseum Basel und Sammlung Ludwig

detail_description: Dreiländereck, also known as the Three-Country Point, is a symbol of the enduring friendship and unity among neighboring countries. It serves as a meeting point for diverse cultures and languages, reflecting the harmonious coexistence of these nations. Visitors can unwind by the picturesque Rhine River and immerse themselves in the beauty of nature while exploring this unique border area.
name: Dreiländereck

excerpt: Papermaking & printing museum in a medieval mill, with hands-on workshops where visitors make paper.
detail_description: Located in the picturesque Rhine River Valley of Switzerland, Basler Papiermühle - Schweizerisches Museum für Papier, Schrift und Druck is a must-visit tourist attraction. Housed in a medieval mill on a canal, this fully-operational museum offers hands-on workshops where visitors can make their own paper and take it home as a souvenir.
name: Basler Papiermühle - Schweizerisches Museum für Papier, Schrift und Druck

excerpt: Gothic-style, Protestant place of worship, with 9th-century origins, twin spires & a tiled roof.
detail_description: The Basler Münster, also known as Basel Minster, is a stunning Gothic-style Protestant cathedral with origins dating back to the 9th century. Its red sandstone walls, colorful roof tiles, and twin towers make it an iconic landmark in Basel. The cathedral's construction spanned several centuries and features a mix of Romantic and Gothic styles. Destroyed in an earthquake in 1356, the impressive structure was rebuilt and converted into a Reformed Protestant Church.
name: Basler Münster

excerpt: Built in 1977, Swiss artist Jean Tinguely's Carnival Fountain merges sculptural machines with water.
detail_description: Tinguely-Brunnen, created in 1977 by Swiss artist Jean Tinguely, is a captivating fusion of sculptural machines and water. Situated on the site of the old city theatre company's stage, this modern landmark features ten iron figures powered by low-voltage current, seemingly playing in the shallow fountain lined with black asphalt. The mechanical figures are in constant motion and interaction with each other, reminiscent of the performers who once graced the theater stage.
name: Tinguely-Brunnen

detail_description: Marktplatz is home to the impressive Basel City Hall, also known as Rathaus. The original building was destroyed in an earthquake, but a new one dating back to the early 16th century now stands in its place. This signature red building is adorned with intricate decorative details, including captivating real and mythological chimeras. Located at Marktplatz, this square also features a striking tree, making it a picturesque spot for admiration and photography.
name: Marktplatz

excerpt: Ethnographic museum, designed by Herzog & de Meuron, showing global artifacts & special exhibitions.
detail_description: The Museum of Cultures Basel, located in Switzerland, is an ethnographic museum with a diverse collection of global artifacts. Established in the 1840s, it houses significant collections from Europe, the South Pacific, Mesoamerica, Tibet and Bali. The museum's origins can be traced back to the city of Basel's Museum of Natural History and Ethnography. Over time, it has expanded its holdings through sponsorships and continuous acquisitions.
name: Museum of Cultures Basel

excerpt: Gallery with art collection from 1960s to present in converted paper factory, & temporary exhibits.
detail_description: The Museum of Contemporary Art, located in Basel, Switzerland, is housed in a converted paper factory and features a diverse art collection from the 1960s to the present. The museum also hosts temporary exhibits showcasing cutting-edge contemporary art from around the world. Established in 1980, it displays various artworks including painting, sculpture, photography, video, and installation art. The institution's innovative exhibitions and programs serve as a vibrant platform for artistic experimentation and cultural dialogue.
name: Museum of Contemporary Art

detail_description: Münsterplatz Basel is a picturesque square located in the heart of the city, adorned with charming old buildings and serving as a popular meeting place for both locals and tourists. The square is home to the impressive cathedral, also known as the Münsterplei, and during Christmas time, it transforms into a magical setting filled with festive stalls from the Weihnachtsmarkt. Visitors can also enjoy concerts and events in this spacious square.
name: Münsterplatz Basel

detail_description: Markthalle is a lively food court located in the heart of Basel, Switzerland. Housed in a historic market hall, it offers a wide range of culinary experiences from around the world. Visitors can explore numerous food stalls and eateries serving fresh and diverse dishes, as well as shop for artisanal products and specialty ingredients. The vibrant atmosphere and mix of cultures make it an interesting destination for those looking to satisfy their hunger with a variety of international cuisines all under one roof.
name: Markthalle

detail_description: Am Rathaus is a charming and historic square located in the heart of a picturesque town. The square is surrounded by beautiful old buildings, cozy cafes, and lively street performers. Visitors can soak up the atmosphere while enjoying a cup of coffee at one of the outdoor terraces or exploring the local shops. The area is known for its vibrant energy and makes for a perfect spot to relax and people-watch.
name: Am Rathaus

excerpt: Free zoo established in 1871 featuring mostly local animals, plus a playground & restaurant.
detail_description: Tierpark Lange Erlen, located in the tranquil surroundings of Lange Erlen Park in Basel, Switzerland, is a free zoo that has been welcoming visitors since 1871. The park is home to a variety of local and exotic animals such as deer, goats, peacocks, wild boars, donkeys, ponies, guinea pigs and rabbits. It offers spacious enclosures and scenic walking trails for wildlife enthusiasts and families to enjoy.
name: Tierpark Lange Erlen

detail_description: The Jewish Museum of Switzerland, situated in Basel, is the country's sole museum dedicated to Jewish religious and everyday history. It offers a comprehensive portrayal of Jewish life and culture in Switzerland from the medieval period to the present day. The museum's collection encompasses ritual objects, art, and daily items from Judaism, providing visitors with a unique perspective on the diverse history of the Swiss Jewish community.
name: Jewish Museum of Switzerland

excerpt: Art adorns this historic town-hall building, home to the local legislature, with tours available.
detail_description: Basel Town Hall, also known as Rathaus, is a historic building located in the heart of the city. Constructed over 500 years ago, it serves as the seat of the local legislature. The vibrant red sandstone exterior makes it a prominent landmark in Marktplatz, where visitors can explore an outdoor marketplace and enjoy street performances. Inside, the town hall features impressive frescoes and a grand wooden staircase.
name: Basel Town Hall

excerpt: Blossoms, trees & cacti in gardens founded in the 1500s, plus a massive Victorian-era greenhouse.
detail_description: The University of Basel Botanical Garden, established in the 16th century, is a serene oasis nestled in the heart of Basel. This historic garden showcases a diverse array of plant specimens and features picturesque grounds along with four greenhouses. Visitors can explore an impressive collection of cacti and orchids, as well as immerse themselves in the lush tropical environment within the tropical house.
name: University of Basel Botanical Garden

excerpt: Altstadt Grossbasel, part of the old town, is a shopping, dining, and cultural hub centering on Marktplatz, a broad square with a produce market overlooked by the striking red Town Hall. The area's museums cover ancient art, music, ethnography, and natural history, while the imposing Basel Minster was consecrated in 1019. The riverside Pfalz terrace has views over the city.
detail_description: Altstadt Grossbasel, located in the old town of Basel, is a vibrant area offering a mix of shopping, dining, and cultural experiences. At its heart lies Marktplatz, a spacious square hosting a lively produce market and the impressive red Town Hall. The district is home to various museums showcasing ancient art, music, ethnography, and natural history. Visitors can also marvel at the historic Basel Minster which dates back to 1019.
name: Altstadt Grossbasel

detail_description: Basel SBB, the bustling Swiss Federal Railways station in Basel, stands as a pivotal transportation hub for both domestic and international travelers. This modern facility not only offers efficient services but also connects visitors to a myriad of destinations across Switzerland and Europe. Whether you're hopping on a high-speed train from Zurich or making your way to Paris or Frankfurt, Basel SBB ensures that your journey is both scenic and seamless.
name: Basel SBB

detail_description: Novartis Campus in Basel is a modern architectural marvel that attracts architecture enthusiasts and visitors alike. It's conveniently located close to the city center and easily accessible from various transportation points. The campus features well-maintained buildings with a unique design theme, making it a popular spot for sightseeing and photography. While access to offices is restricted, visitors can explore shops and restaurants on the premises. The campus also hosts extensive research and development activities, making it an impressive destination for those interested in innovation.
name: Novartis Campus

excerpt: State-of -the-art theatre hosts musicals, shows & concerts & also has a bistro for dining.
detail_description: Musical Theater Basel is a state-of-the-art venue that hosts a variety of entertainment, including musicals, shows, and concerts. The theater features an ideal stage for major touring theatre and dance productions, as well as hosting several festivals showcasing international dance and theatre productions. Visitors can enjoy classic musicals like 'The Phantom of the Opera' and 'Cats,' along with concerts. The theater also offers a bistro for dining.
name: Musical Theater Basel

detail_description: St. Paul's Church in Basel is a stunning reformed church that was built at the turn of the 20th century. The facade wall features an intricate openwork rose, striking mosaics, and a tower adorned with ornate statues and clocks. Upon entering, visitors are greeted by the statue of the Archangel Michael engaged in battle with a dragon.
name: St. Paul's Church, Basel

excerpt: Art gallery in a Gothic building, showing political cartoons & caricatures plus themed exhibitions.
detail_description: Located in a Gothic building, the Caricature & Cartoon Museum Basel is a unique attraction dedicated exclusively to political cartoons and caricatures. It also hosts themed exhibitions showcasing the history and evolution of these art forms, featuring works by Swiss and international artists. The museum offers visitors an insightful look into satirical art.
name: Caricature & Cartoon Museum Basel

detail_description: Art Basel is a renowned modern and contemporary art fair that takes place in Basel, Switzerland. The event attracts art enthusiasts from around the world who come to experience exhibitions by leading galleries. In addition to its prestigious university and diverse cultural events, Basel is also known for its impressive museums and contemporary architecture. Visitors can explore historic hotels, bed & breakfasts, family-owned inns, apartments, and private accommodations while enjoying excellent dining options in the city.
name: Art Basel

detail_description: Roche Tower, also known as Building 1, is a striking skyscraper that dominates the skyline of Basel, Switzerland. Soaring to a height of 178 meters, it holds the distinction of being the country's tallest building. Constructed at a cost of 550 million Swiss francs and financed by pharmaceutical giant Hoffman La Roche, this architectural marvel opened its doors to the public in 2015.
name: Roche Tower (Building 1)

excerpt: Chic quarters, some with balconies, in a fashionable hotel offering a restaurant & a rooftop bar.
detail_description: ART HOUSE Basel - Member of Design Hotels is a stylish hotel with chic rooms, some featuring balconies, and amenities like a restaurant and rooftop bar. The hotel's location in Basel makes it an ideal starting point for exploring the city's attractions such as the historic Basel Town Hall and the unique Hoosesagg Museum. It is also conveniently situated near top-rated hotels and popular landmarks.
name: ART HOUSE Basel - Member of Design Hotels

excerpt: Leafy St. Alban is an upscale residential district dotted with villas and Gothic and baroque merchants’ houses. A remnant of Basel’s medieval fortifications, the St. Alban Tor city gate and watchtower dates from around 1400. FC Basel soccer team plays its home games at the modern St. Jakob-Park stadium, while the hip Das Viertel club presents international DJs and live acts, and has a popular rooftop restaurant.
detail_description: Basel-St. Alban is an elegant residential area featuring luxurious villas and historic Gothic and baroque houses. The district boasts the medieval St. Alban Tor city gate and watchtower, a remnant of Basel's ancient fortifications. Additionally, it is home to the modern St. Jakob-Park stadium where FC Basel plays its home games, as well as the trendy Das Viertel club with international DJs and live performances, along with a popular rooftop restaurant.
name: Basel-St. Alban

detail_description: Kleinbasel is a vibrant and diverse neighborhood located on the southern bank of the Rhine River in Basel, Switzerland. It is known for its lively atmosphere, trendy shops, and eclectic mix of restaurants and cafes. The area is also home to cultural attractions such as the Museum der Kulturen and the Kaserne cultural center. Kleinbasel offers a unique blend of old-world charm with modern amenities, making it a popular destination for both locals and tourists alike.
name: Kleinbasel

detail_description: The Rhine Swimming Entrance is a popular annual event that draws thousands of people to jump into the water and enjoy the experience of being carried away by the waves. The location offers easy access to the water, with a large beach area for visitors to start their floating journey. It's recommended to bring sandals as the riverbed can be slippery. The transparent waters and expansive beaches make it an ideal spot for swimming during summer days.
name: Rhine Swimming Entrance

detail_description: Spalenberg is a charming and picturesque street in the heart of Basel, Switzerland. It is lined with historic buildings, colorful facades, and an array of shops, cafes, and restaurants. The area has a lively atmosphere with plenty of opportunities for shopping and dining. Visitors can explore the narrow cobblestone streets and admire the well-preserved medieval architecture. Spalenberg is a popular destination for both locals and tourists looking to soak up the city's rich history while enjoying its vibrant contemporary culture.
name: Spalenberg

detail_description: The Fine Arts Museum Basel is renowned for housing the world's oldest art collection and is a major attraction in Switzerland. The museum features an extensive range of art, including Medieval, Renaissance, 17th, 18th, and 20th-century pieces as well as modern works. Visitors appreciate the unique architectural design of the museum and enjoy various temporary exhibitions by both renowned and emerging artists.
name: Fine Arts Museum Basel | New Building

detail_description: Kunstmuseum, located in the town center, is a renowned art museum that showcases a wide range of artworks from early to contemporary pieces. The museum features impressive collections including works by Hodler, Anker, Impressionists, Rodin, and traditional biblical pieces. Visitors can also explore the extensive 3 museums displaying art from different periods. The new building offers more interesting exhibitions compared to the old one.
name: Kunstmuseum

excerpt: Indoor food market with stalls serving cuisine from around the world, plus covered outdoor seating.
detail_description: Markthalle Basel is a popular indoor food market in Basel, offering a wide variety of international cuisines from different countries. The market features numerous stalls where visitors can sample diverse dishes and enjoy their meals at the large communal tables inside the unique building. In addition to the culinary offerings, Markthalle Basel hosts evening events and a weekly Sunday brunch known as 'Zmorgeland.' Families with children can take advantage of the small play area while parents dine at surrounding tables.
name: Markthalle Basel

excerpt: Guided tours of FC Basel 1893's home stadium including access to the subs bench & VIP areas.
detail_description: St. Jakob-Park is a modern and comfortable stadium located in Basel, Switzerland. It is the home of FC Basel 1893 and offers guided tours that include access to the subs bench and VIP areas. The stadium has a capacity of over 6,000 seated spectators as well as standing spaces for additional visitors. St. Jakob-Park hosts various football games, sporting events, athletics games, and concerts throughout the year.
name: St. Jakob-Park

excerpt: Museum with natural history exhibits ranging from zoology to paleontology, plus events & a shop.
detail_description: Naturhistorisches Museum Basel, also known as the Museum of Natural History, is one of the five state-run museums in Basel. It offers a wide range of natural history exhibits, including zoology and paleontology. The museum is well-maintained and features an extensive collection of curiosities and showpiece specimens that make it a fascinating place to explore for a few hours. Visitors can immerse themselves in exhibitions covering various natural sciences, from rocks and minerals to extinct flora and fauna.
name: Naturhistorisches Museum Basel

detail_description: The Fernet Branca Foundation, located in Saint-Louis near Basel, is an art museum established in 2004 within a renovated former distillery. It focuses on contemporary art and regularly hosts diverse temporary exhibitions showcasing various artists' works. The museum also features a designer/book store and a coffee shop, making it an enriching cultural destination for art enthusiasts. Visitors have praised the beautiful exhibition space and the friendly staff, making it a worthwhile stop for those interested in modern art.
name: Fernet Branca Foundation

excerpt: Grand building for cultural events that also features a modern bar, classic brasserie & beer garden.
detail_description: Brasserie, Bar und Event Volkshaus Basel is a historic building dating back to the 14th century that has been transformed into a popular cultural and dining destination. The venue underwent a major refurbishment by renowned local architecture firm Herzog & de Meuron, resulting in an eclectic mix of furnishings and modern design elements. The bar offers a diverse menu featuring high-quality Swiss, French, and Spanish wines, beer from a nearby microbrewery, and tapas snacks.
name: Brasserie, Bar und Event Volkshaus Basel

excerpt: Elegant, riverside eatery in the Grand Hotel Les Trois Rois with refined & innovative French dishes.
detail_description: Cheval Blanc by Peter Knogl is an elegant and refined riverside restaurant located in the Grand Hotel Les Trois Rois, offering innovative French cuisine. The restaurant prides itself on exceptional service and sourcing the finest ingredients available on the market. With a maximum capacity of 30 guests, the dining experience is set in a beautiful space adorned with striking chandeliers and high ceilings.
name: Cheval Blanc by Peter Knogl

excerpt: Leafy green park with modern play areas, a seasonal splash pool with fountains & an outdoor cafe.
detail_description: Kannenfeldpark, located in Basel, Switzerland, is a family-friendly park with various attractions for all ages. Once a graveyard, it now offers a peaceful escape from the city's hustle and bustle. The park features modern play areas, a seasonal splash pool with fountains, and an outdoor cafe. It spans 10 hectares and hosts popular summer events and celebrations. Visitors can enjoy picnics in the spacious grassy areas or relax in the beautiful rose garden.
name: Kannenfeldpark

excerpt: The borders of Germany, France & Switzerland converge at this point, marked by a monument.
detail_description: Dreiländereck, also known as the Three-Country Point, is a significant landmark where the borders of Germany, France, and Switzerland intersect. This spot is marked by a monument that symbolizes the friendship and harmony between these nations. Visitors can relax by the Rhine River and immerse themselves in nature while taking in breathtaking views of the surrounding landscapes. The area seamlessly accommodates pedestrians and cyclists, promoting cross-border exploration and fostering friendships.
name: Border Triangle Basel

excerpt: Exhibitions of local & international art & program of cultural events in an 1869 building.
detail_description: Kunsthalle Basel, housed in an 1869 building, is one of the oldest cultural institutions in the city. It was established to promote artistic activity and foster creative exchange among artists and art professionals. The museum features temporary exhibitions by both national and international contemporary artists, showcasing a diverse range of artworks. While it has a collection of about 500 artworks not open to the public, its main focus is on hosting these rotating exhibitions.
name: Kunsthalle Basel

excerpt: Family-friendly theatre hosting kids shows, producing outdoor theatre events & leading workshops.
detail_description: The Theater Basel is a family-friendly venue that offers a variety of entertainment options for both kids and adults. It hosts children's shows, outdoor theater events, and workshops. The theater's unique architecture includes a cafe on the top floor and an auditorium that seamlessly flows into the stage area without barriers. Visitors can enjoy watching rehearsals while kids play freely around the building.
name: Theater Basel

excerpt: Herzog & de Meuron-designed warehouse for rolling exhibitions of major contemporary artists.
detail_description: Laurenz-Stiftung Schaulager is a Herzog & de Meuron-designed warehouse that hosts rotating exhibitions featuring major contemporary artists. Basel boasts numerous renowned museums, including Fondation Beyeler, Museum Tinguely, and the Kunsthalle. The city also houses the lesser-known Pharmacy Museum at the University of Basel, offering insights into the history of medicines.
name: Laurenz-Stiftung Schaulager
